solution_line_template: The total ratio of the coins they both have is {elsa_ratio_part}+{amalie_ratio_part} = <<{elsa_ratio_part}+{amalie_ratio_part}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts}

The fraction of the ratio representing the number of coins that Amalie has is {amalie_ratio_fraction}, and since the total number of coins they both have is {total_coins}, Amalie has {amalie_ratio_fraction}*{total_coins} = <<{amalie_ratio_fraction}*{total_coins}={amalie_coins}>>{amalie_coins} coins.
When Amalie spends {spent_fraction} of what she has, she parts with {spent_fraction}*{amalie_coins} = <<{spent_fraction}*{amalie_coins}={coins_spent}>>{coins_spent} coins.
She still has {amalie_coins} coins - {coins_spent} coins = <<{amalie_coins}-{coins_spent}={remaining_coins}>>{remaining_coins} coins
